task_summary: Detect, grasp, and raise the small white carton on the right side of the table, then retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A table-top manipulation scene features several objects (red cup, blue can, green glass bottle, orange items, and a small white carton at the right). The robot must locate the white carton, align for a top grasp, securely grasp it, and raise it a short distance above the table to demonstrate lifting. The behavior emphasizes reliable perception, alignment with tight tolerance, and post-grasp stability before lifting. A short retreat clears the workspace after the raise.
preconditions: White carton present within reachable workspace
stepwise_plan: Perceive the white carton or perform a short scan
Open gripper and move to a pregrasp above the carton
Align with tight tolerance and set yaw
Compute grasp pose (top) and execute grasp with pinch
Raise the held carton by 0.15 m
success_criteria: Carton lifted at least 0.10 m above tabletop
Object remains stably in gripper (no slip)
Robot ends in a safe, non-interfering pose
failure_and_recovery: If object not visible: perform scan and re-detect
If grasp fails/slips: reopen, recompute grasp, and retry
If alignment fails: re-approach with same tolerance
task_long_description.termination: Terminate once the raise and retreat succeed with a stable grasp.

frame_3.now_evidence: Manipulator is closely aligned near the right-side objects where the white carton sits.
frame_3.predicts_next: Grasp attempt is imminent, confirming approach direction and pregrasp alignment.

node_specs.description: Active search if the carton is not immediately visible.
Perception pass to localize the carton.
Orient end-effector for a top pinch.
Verify stable grasp prior to lifting.
Back off to a safe pose after raising.

failure_modes: Object not detected due to occlusion/blur
Grasp pose inaccurate leading to slip
Collision with nearby bottle/cup during approach
recovery_strategy: Re-approach with same tolerance and orientation
Open gripper and restart from perception step
assumptions: The 'white carton' refers to the small light/white rectangular item on the right side of the table; lifting distance of 0.15 m is sufficient to count as 'raise'. Frames are slightly blurred; interpretation relies on spatial layout.

expected_success_criteria: Gripper maintains hold during lift and retreat
